See the Problem, Stop the Danger, Change the Cycle

According to the US Department of State, every year,
14,500 to 17,500 individuals, from ages as young as 8-12, are human trafficked.

Nevada has been a habitat for human trafficking, with 200 cases being reported, on average.
89% of it consists of sex-trafficking, higher than the national average of 71%
(UNLV Center for Crime and Justice Policy)

It stops here.

Teens Against Trafficking strives to stop the cycle of abuse using a 4 step method:

Education

Teens Against Trafficking is working to educate the population. We are doing stuff!

Reach Out

Teens Against Trafficking is working to reach out to the population. We are doing stuff!

Support Victims

Teens Against Trafficking is working to support victims. We are doing stuff!

Raise Awareness

Teens Against Trafficking is working to raise awareness. We are doing stuff!

Join us today to make a difference in our community.
